title: Atari 2600 quickref
text:
Gather an Atari 2600 (henceforth “Atari”), an Atari 2600 game cartridge (henceforth “cart”), a VCR, an RCA to F adapter (henceforth “adapter”), and component cables.
Set channel switch on Atari to 2 Attach F end of adapter to VCR, then plug Atari RCA cable into it. Link the VCR and TV with the component cables. Turn on TV and set to Channel 2. Turn on VCR and set to Channel 2. Put the cart in the Atari and power it on.
Enjoy video game.

title: How to softmod your PS1
text:
The PS1 can be soft-modded by creating a UNIROM memory card. Below are instructions on how to install UNIROM onto a standard PS1 memory card.
Note: If your console model is SCPH-1001 or SCPH-9002, two memory cards are required.
Gather

PS2
Memory card with FMCB or FHDB installed
FAT32-formatted USB drive

Creating a UNIROM card is accomplished with a PS2, a program called Memory Card (MC) Annihilator, and FreePSXBoot (the exploit for the PS1). A memory card with FreePSXBoot installed is known as a UNIROM card.
MC Annihilator is an elf program that can be launched with LaunchELF. It is used to format the PS1 card (if not already formatted) and “restore” the FreePSXBoot image.




The software is provided at https://www.github.com/brad-lin/FreePSXBoot/releases
Get the model number from the PS1 (e.g. SCPH-101). Find that model in the table, then copy the associated installer filename (extension mcd).
Scroll down, and find the hyperlink to the installer.



Go to PSX-Place and download MC Annihilator (software) by ffgriever.
https://www.psx-place.com/resources/memory-card-annihilator-coded-by-ffgriever-gfx-by-berion.673/
Extract “MC Annihilator v2.0.zip”. Copy the extracted folder and the FreePSXBoot software (mcd file) to the root of the USB drive.




Insert the USB drive into one of the PS2’s USB ports. Insert the FMCB card into the left slot and the PS1 card into the right slot. Boot up the PS2. Launch LaunchELF (or uLaunchELF).
Find mass0:/. Open the folder for MC Annihilator. Run mca_v20.elf. Select Slot 2.
Note: If the PS1 card has not been formatted, MC Annihilator has a format utility. Regardless of if you format it with the PS1 or PS2 ahead of time, or format it with MC Annihilator’s formatting tool, just make sure to do it. Tl;dr: Format the PS1 memory card.
Run “Restore MC image”. Find mass0:/ and drill into it. Press R2 to reveal the mcd file. (R2 disables the file mask.) Select the mcd file. This writes the image to the PS1 card. Power off the PS2, and remove the PS1 card and USB drive.



Plug the PS1 card into the left slot on the PS1. Turn on the PS1. UNIROM will load and a home screen will appear. The UNIROM card can be removed.
The Boot CD allows backup discs to be played. It can also run original discs from other regions or backups of those.

title: How to softmod your PS2
text:
Free Memory Card Boot, a.k.a FreeMCBoot or FMCB is the solution for most PS2 models. Later 90000-series models require another solution, covered separately.
FMCB cards can run several programs. Some essential ones are

Open PS2 Loader (OPL)
uLaunchElf




Todo

title: How to softmod your PS2
text:
Playing backup ISOs

Via USB
Not recommended, as USB 1 is too slow for FMVs and games struggle to play.


Via HDD
A great option.


Via local network
Todo.


Via MC2SIO
An easy option.

title: Stock PS3
text:
A few notes:

Games can only be purchased on the console.
Funds have to be pre-loaded to your account using the PlayStation Store or PS5.
Games must be downloaded from the store listing (at time of writing).
Digital titles need 2 × (game size) amount of free hard drive space to install.




Go to https://store.playstation.com/
Sign in
Click your avatar (upper-right corner), then click Payment Management, then click Add Funds.
Choose a funding method and select one of the options ($5, …, $60).





Settings > Users and Accounts
Account > Payment and Subscriptions > Add Funds







https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_PlayStation_3_games



https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_PlayStation_2_Classics_for_PlayStation_3

title: Stock PS3
text:
Custom firmware
Backing up discs Backing up with custom firmware (CWF) Backing up PS3 discs PS3 discs can only be backed up with a shortlist of Blu-Ray drives or using a PS3 with custom firmware (CFW).
RPCS3 provides a list of Blu-Ray drives that can successfully rip PS3 discs. This method requires using a third-party software to retrieve files that decrypt (?) the discs.
How to do things on the PS3…
The PS3 Move Controllers work without a battery:
https://gamefaqs.gamespot.com/boards/927750-playstation-3/71118884
Press and hold power button to enter safe mode.
Official PS3 firmware download: https://www.playstation.com/en-us/support/hardware/ps3/system-software/
Brewology webMAN Drop pkg file onto FAT32 Activate HEN Package Manager > Install Package Files > Standard Scroll down to installer System will restart webMAN games PS3 webMAN
Set to SYSCON
Access critical system information from the XMB
Hold select to open VSH menu Option to dump disc to hard drive
Can also let you remote play from your PC (just have to visit IP address in browser on PC)
PS1, PS2, and PS3 games can be played on PS3 RetroArch can be installed on PS3
